feed.title: NewsTracker: apple
feed.subtitle: This is a news tracking demo

entry.title: Inside Apple's Top Secret Apple Watch Fitness Lab
entry.summary: "[The employees] knew they were testing something, but they didn't know it was for the Apple Watch," said Jeff Williams, Apple's senior vice president of operations.

entry.title: New Apple TV with App Store and Siri 'will be unveiled in June'
Tag Heuer, Intel challenge Apple with Android smartwatch
entry.summary: "With Apple Watch hitting the market it's no longer viable for Swiss watchmakers to bury their heads in the sand. Now Tag Heuer has signalled its intention to enter the smartwatch market we are certain others will follow."

entry.title: Stock of iPhone maker Apple is added to the Dow; set to start trading in the index Thursday
entry.summary:
Apple Inc. was added to the Dow after the market closed Wednesday.

The Dow will begin trading with Apple stock when the markets open Thursday.

Apple, based in Cupertino, California, has a market value of $748 billion.

entry.title: Only 39% of iPhone users interested in Apple Watch: poll
entry.summary:
Among the iPhone owners, 39% were interested in purchasing the Apple watch, including 17% describing themselves as very interested.

By contrast, the social conversation for Apple's iPhone 6 during the same week was 5% positive and 0% negative, according to the analysis.

entry.title: U.S. poll shows 40 per cent of iPhone owners would buy Apple Watch
entry.summary:
About 40 percent of adult Apple iPhone owners in the United States are interested in buying the company's new Apple Watch, according to a new Reuters/Ipsos poll.

Because the watch needs an iPhone to work fully, analysts say the most likely pool of initial buyers will already have an Apple smartphone in their pockets.

Discussions about the watch have flooded online social media channels such as Twitter and Facebook since Apple held a splashy event in San Francisco on March 9 to showcase the watch.

Among the conversations relating to the Apple watch during the one-week period, 5.8 per cent of the comments showed an intent to purchase, according to Networked Insights, which analyzes tweets, public Facebook posts and other sources.

entry.title: Nearly 40 percent of iPhone owners interested in Apple Watch: poll
entry.summary:
Owners of the iPhone are a particularly important market for Apple as it launches the new watch, which goes on sale April 24.

But he expected Apple's cache and marketing might to deliver strong initial sales of the Apple Watch.

"Winning Apple customers is more realistic at this point," said Hargreaves.

Social media chatter about the Apple watch was 15 percent positive and 5 percent negative in the week following Apple's event, according to an analysis that the firm Networked Insights conducted for Reuters.

Apple is among several large tech companies looking to jumpstart a new market for "wearable" electronic devices.

entry.title: Apple TV 'skinny' package likely to accelerate cord cutting
entry.summary: Apple is said to be focusing on deals with companies such as 21st Century Fox that own both a major broadcast network and cable channels.

entry.title: Apple and banks dismiss Apple Pay fraud worries
entry.summary: "The bank then determines and approves whether a card can be added to Apple Pay."

entry.title: Apple planning streaming TV service
Apple in talks to launch online TV service: Report
entry.summary:
Apple, which is aiming to price the new service at about $30 to $40 a month, plans to announce the service in June and launch it in September, the newspaper said.

Apple spokesman Tom Neumayr said the company does not comment on rumor and speculation.

Apple is not in talks with NBCUniversal, owner of the NBC broadcast network and cable channels like USA and Bravo, because of a falling-out between Apple and NBCUniversal parent company Comcast, the Journal said.

Apple and Comcast were in early-stage discussions last year to offer a streaming-television service that would allow Apple set-top boxes to bypass congestion on the web.

entry.title: Apple's $40-a-month TV streaming service could launch in June: 25 channels will be available across iOS devices
entry.summary: Apple also recently cut the price of its Apple TV from $99 to $69.

entry.title: Apple in talks to launch online TV service: Report
entry.summary:
The tech giant is working with programmers to offer a bundled service of about 25 channels anchored by broadcasters like ABC, CBS and Fox, on devices such as Apple TV.

The service will not offer NBC broadcast network and cable channels such as USA and Bravo, after a fallout between Apple and Comcast, parent of NBC and CNBC, the report said.

entry.title: Liking Apple too much a big problem for fund managers
Liking Apple too much a big problem for fund managers
entry.summary:
Yet that devotion for Apple is a problem for Burnham and some other managers of so-called diversified funds like his - they want more Apple than they can buy under self-imposed risk-reducing guidelines that typically have them holding no more than 5% of their assets in any one company.

Burnham and the 174 fund managers like him who hold large stakes of their diversified portfolios in Apple are pulled in two directions: hoping to prevent an unforeseen drop in Apple shares from upending their portfolios, while also benefiting from a company whose shares are up 12% this year so far.

Burham didn't set out to have such a big stake in Apple, he said.

Other fund managers with large stakes in Apple who aren't selling say that they didn't set out to have an oversized position in the company.

David Chiueh, the manager of the Upright Growth fund, has 13.4% in Apple, the second-largest among diversified funds tracked by Lipper, mostly because shares he bought in 2008 have appreciated, he said.

entry.title: Apple Watch may be a tough sell with Americans: 69% not interested in buying the gadget, new poll shows
entry.summary:
Some 46% of respondents said that the Apple Watch had a "cool factor."

But only 29% said they were more interested in purchasing an Apple Watch than another brand of smartwatch.

entry.title: iPhone fitness app only visible when you pair an Apple Watch?
entry.summary: HOW LONG WILL APPLE WATCH'S BATTERY LAST?

entry.title: CIA sought to hack Apple iPhones: Report
Snowden: CIA tried to hack Apple devices for nearly a decade
entry.summary:
Efforts to break into Apple products by government security researchers started as early as 2006, a year before Apple introduced its first iPhone and continued through the launch of the iPad in 2010 and beyond, The Intercept said.

Last September, Apple strengthened encryption methods for data stored on iPhones, saying the changes meant the company no longer had any way to extract customer data on the devices, even if a government ordered it to with a search warrant.

entry.title: CIA allegedly sought to hack Apple iPhones from earliest days
entry.summary: An Apple spokesman pointed to public statements by Chief Executive Tim Cook on privacy but declined to comment further.

entry.title: 3 reasons Apple's watch will _ or won't _ change the game
entry.summary:
The stakes are big for Apple CEO Tim Cook: the watch is the first brand-new Apple product to be launched without legendary co-founder Steve Jobs.

MORE FEATURES THAN RIVALS: Along with email, texts and phone calls, Apple says its watch will present news, health readings and other notifications in creative ways that can be read at a glance.

Apple plans to sell three models, starting at $349, but Piper Jaffray's Gene Munster predicts the average buyer will pay $550 for a watch and extra, interchangeable bands.

entry.title: Will the Apple Watch finally move the needle in the smartwatch industry? Here's why & why not
entry.summary: Apple is working with outside companies to create more apps; Cook has talked about using the watch as an electronic "key" for hotel doors or even cars.

entry.title: Apple is joining the Dow Jones index
entry.summary: "As the largest corporation in the world and a leader in technology, Apple is the clear choice for the Dow," said David Blitzer, chairman of the index committee at S&P Dow Jones Indices.

entry.title: Apple to join Dow Jones stock index
entry.summary: Apple will start trading as part of the 30-stock Dow at the opening of trading the next day.

entry.title: Apple to Replace AT&T in Dow Jones Industrial Average
entry.summary: Apple's stock rose $2.55, or 2 percent, to $128.99 in early trading on Friday.

entry.title: News of robust hiring in US month sends bonds lower, dollar higher; Apple gains, will join Dow
entry.summary: Apple rose 1 percent early Friday after it was announced that the company would be joining the Dow Jones industrial average, replacing AT&T.

entry.title: Apple to replace AT&T in Dow Industrials
entry.summary: Tech giant Apple is joining the Dow Jones Industrial Average, replacing AT&T.

entry.title: 3 reasons Apple's watch will _ or won't _ change the game
entry.summary:
Is the Apple Watch going to be able to do the same?

Here are three reasons the Apple Watch will finally move the needle in the smartwatch industry - and three reasons it might not.

And Siri and Apple Pay will be built in.

A recent Forrester survey found some respondents didn't see a reason to buy one because they already owned a less-expensive fitness band or a full-featured smartphone (although it also found Apple fans ready to buy the new watch).

By comparison, Apple sold 74.6 million iPhones in just the last quarter.

Apple's high-fashion "Edition" model, made with 18-karat gold, is expected to cost thousands.

Cook will make his case for the Apple Watch at a press event Monday, where he's expected to show off more features and apps.

entry.title: IPhone 6's popularity drives Apple's China share to record
entry.summary: That was a record for Apple in the world's largest smartphone market, but not enough to catch up Chinese maker Xiaomi, which claimed 27.6 percent.

entry.title: HBO will launch online streaming service in April for $15
entry.summary: Apple will be behind the launch of HBO Now, according to the Times.

entry.title: Researchers say Apple, Android browsers were vulnerable to outdated encryption
entry.summary:
Apple Inc. and Google Inc. both said Tuesday they have created software updates to fix the "FREAK attack" flaw, which derives its name from an acronym of technical terms.

Apple said its fix will be available next week and Google said it has provided an update to device makers and wireless carriers.

entry.title: WIRELESS SHOW HIGHLIGHTS: Eyes on Apple, BlackBerry
entry.summary:
Apple's campaign comes as Samsung unveiled new phones with improved photo-taking capabilities.

The two companies have been fierce rivals, and one research firm said Tuesday that Apple bested Samsung as the world's top smartphone maker in the last three months of 2014.

Apple Inc. isn't at the Mobile World Congress show this week, but is making its presence felt, as new phones are inevitably compared with iPhones.

Apple has its own event Monday in San Francisco, where it's expected to reveal more details about its upcoming smartwatch.

Apple is turning over a large portion of its home page, along with billboard and print ads in dozens of cities, to photos from its "Shot on iPhone 6" campaign.

entry.title: The top 10 books on Apple's iBooks-US
Apple may be working on electric car: report
Report: Apple has hundreds working on electric car project
entry.summary:
Apple has confirmed that Newson is on its staff.

The Journal notes that Apple is always experimenting with new products, many eventually abandoned.
